revisionDesc.change: Finalized - ready
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Accept. This restores a comment to the change description.
Manual restoration of external editorial comment (see <change> beginning "I sent W. Clarysse...")XML Markup Change
Finalized - ready

Vote - AcceptText - Ἁροββροοῦς is clearly correct. About the name Τααοῦς, which is printed at the top of the list of contracting parties here and in line 1 of the contract itself, see the editorial history of PSI 8.913.
Vote - AcceptText - Fix line break in lins19-20. See comments below.

I sent W. Clarysse the proposed emendation and my voting comments, plus the observation that at P.Mich. V 298.ctr.1 [Τ]αα[οῦ]ς, which is used as the parallel to support the new reading at PSI VIII 913.1, is almost entirely illegible in the online image. He replied, "I completely agree. The identification of the two women appears certain, but the name is not legible. In P.Mich. V 298 I cannot read anything, in PSI VIII 913 the reading of the edit princeps lambda-alpha is preferable to that of the corrector. Feminine names beginning with La- are very rare of course, but Ta- does not seem possible to me."

Vote - DEFER - DEFER. Ἁροββροους is clearly legible in the online image; great. But this must go out to a Sr Editor (W. Clarysse), because [Τ]αα[οῦ]ς here is used to justify emendation at PSI VIII 913.1 (which should go to the same ed). The two must be treated together. Moreover, in the same UMich image [Τ]αα[οῦ]ς is almost entirely illegible. If it is to be retained, I would strongly urge dotting every letter.

Vote - ReturnToSender - Please take a look at the following files in papyri.info: papyri.info/ddbdp/sb;22;15336; papyri.info/ddbdp/p.vind.sal;;7; papyri.info/ddbdp/p.oxy;8;112; papyri.info/ddbdp/sb;20;15020. If you click on the Editorial history and look at the submission notes it will indicate to you how we would like to enter these types of correction.
Vote - ReturnToSender - In the submission comments box please explain in some detail what has been changed and why.
proposed correction, center, line 1: Ἁροβροους (l. Ἁροβροοῦτος) → Ἁροββροους (l. Ἁροββροοῦτος) based on digital image (Michigan APIS); ed. pr. omits the second beta

proposed correction in center line 1, based on digital image (http://quod.lib.umich.edu/a/apis/x-3091/722R_A.TIF?chaperone=S-APIS-X-3091+722R.TIF;lasttype=boolean;lastview=reslist;resnum=3;start=1;subview=detail;view=entry;rgn1=ic_all;select1=all;q1=722)
rationalized languages in langUsage
changed editor names to URIs
Automatic insertion of lb tags into origs to match existing lb tags in the reg
Third automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
changed type=inWord to break=no
Automatically updated revision description
Automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
batch converted all tei:sic to tei:orig and tei:corr to tei:reg
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Added language la-Grek
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
Automated split from transcoder files
